intro: Piptolepis rosmarinifolia, commonly known as silverleaf daisies, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its silvery-gray leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators.
